text.sentence: This year's conference marks our fifth time utilizing the Audience Response System ­ real time audience polling on sentiment and investment debates.
We find the data to be quite powerful and believe it can be an unbiased measure of consensus.
two thousand sixteen results illustrate a more cautious view on Industrials by the buy side audience.
Ownership this year fell to thirty percent from thirty three percent last year, with percent of overweight stocks falling in line .
This year, twenty three percent of respondents were negatively biased toward the stocks in question, up from seventeen percent last year, and versus an average of fifteen.five
Valuation expectations have fallen, too, with respondents indicating the right multiple for industrials is fourteen.fivex
By subsector: Positive sentiment was lowest for Machinery at eleven percent .
Multis / Chems / Autos were similar at thirty seven percent, thirty eight percent and thirty nine percent respectively.
A and D and Transports were next, at forty three percent and forty four percent respectively.
Negative sentiment was highest for Machinery and autos ; Paper and Packaging sentiment was least negative at eleven percent .
Individual names: Out of favor names this year include AGCO, CAT, CMI, GWW, and ROK.
Regarding cash use: This year we saw a meaningful shift in preference toward M and A and away from share repurchases and dividends.
Interestingly, bolt on M and A and large M and A was preferred nineteen percent of the time and fourteen percent of the time, respectively .
Preference for share repurchases fell to thirty one percent from thirty nine percent last year and dividends to ten percent from fifteen percent .
Preference for debt pay down also went up, to fifteen percent, from nine percent .
This year, for the first time, we asked audiences if the presenting company was positioned better than, in line, or worse than peers for a new normal .
Per the audience, forty seven percent of companies that presented are positioned better than peers, telling us that we have not yet decided who the potential winners will be.
Unchanged U.S. Multi Industry Scott R. Davis, CFA one.two

Audience response system aims at gauging client sentiment and generating instant feedback for management teams on stage.
We had ~thirty sixty responses per question, giving us what we think is a statistically significant sample of the investor base.
FIGURE one Audience Response: Summary Data for two thousand twelve two thousand sixteen

Barclays | U.S. Multi Industry Ownership: DAL and SEE were the most overweight names polled, with forty four percent and forty three percent, respectively.
GWW and CMI were the lowest, with four percent and three percent of respondents overweight, respectively.
FIGURE two Audience Response: Do You Own This Stock? two thousand sixteen
FIGURE three Audience Response: Do You Own This Stock? two thousand fifteen
Barclays | U.S. Multi Industry Sentiment: Bias on stocks leaned negative for the majority of the names ­ SEE had the highest positive sentiment, followed by AVY, DHR, GD and HON.
AGCO, CAT and GWW had the lowest levels of positive sentiment .

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
To see a list of companies that comprise a particular industry coverage universe, please go to http://publicresearch.barclays
